content.question: An object is moving in a straight line along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis. The momentum of the object <math alttext="p sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>p</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is shown in the graph above. Which statement below correctly describes the net force that the object experiences during the time period shown?

choices.label: The net force is decreasing over time.
The net force is increasing over time.
The net force is constant and positive.
The net force is constant and negative.

The net force is positive for <math alttext="0 less than t, less than 6 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> and negative for <math alttext="6 seconds less than t, less than 10 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>10</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>.

content.answer: The net force is constant and negative.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
